spatial_reasoner.cpp
Go to the documentation of this file.
1 /* University of Genoa - Software Architecture for Robotics (2017/2018) */
2 /* Project: Teleoperation with MIRO - Mateus Sanches Moura, Suman Ghosh */
3 /* Spatial Reasoner service source code */
4 
5 /* Libraries */
6 #include "ros/ros.h"
7 #include "miro_teleop/SpatialReasoner.h"
8 #include <cstdio>
9 #include <cmath>
10 
11 /* Constants */
12 #define PI 3.14159
13 #define NZ 5 // Number of relations (north, south, west, east, distance-to)
14 #define HSIZE 400 // Horizontal map size (in cm)
15 #define VSIZE 400 // Vertical map size (in cm)
16 #define RES 40 // Grid resolution
17 
18 /* Service function */
19 bool SpatialReasoner(miro_teleop::SpatialReasoner::Request &req,
20  miro_teleop::SpatialReasoner::Response &res)
21 {
22  /* Matrices to be sent back to master (mapped in an 1-D array) */
23  std_msgs::Float64 M[NZ*RES*RES];
24 
25  /* Obstacle center obtained from motion capture */
26  double xr = req.center.x;
27  double yr = req.center.y;
28  /* Obstacle dimensions obtained as well */
29  double a = req.dimensions[0].data;
30  double b = req.dimensions[1].data;
31 
32  /* Other definitions */
33  double xp, yp, xq, yq, xv, yv;
34  double angle, beta_min, beta, dist_min, dist;
35  double c_ang, s_ang; // Store cosines and sines to increase performance
36 
37  ROS_INFO("Request received from master node");
38 
39  /* For every element P=(x,y) of the grid, compute the pertinences */
40  for(int x=0;x<RES;x++)
41  {
42  for(int y=0;y<RES;y++)
43  {
44  /* Map indices to actual location on the map */
45  xp = HSIZE/double(2*RES)+HSIZE*(x/double(RES))-HSIZE/2;
46  yp = VSIZE/double(2*RES)+VSIZE*(y/double(RES))-VSIZE/2;
47  /* If P is inside the obstacle, pertinences are null */
48  if((xp>(xr-a/2))&&(xp<(xr+a/2))
49  &&(yp>(yr-b/2))&&(yp<(yr+b/2)))
50  {
51  for(int dir=0; dir<NZ; dir++)
52  M[x+y*RES+dir*RES*RES].data=0;
53  }
54  /* Otherwise, compute with respect to each direction */
55  else
56  {
57  for(int dir=0; dir<NZ-1; dir++)
58  {
59  angle = dir*PI/2; // Direction angle
60  c_ang = cos(angle);
61  s_ang = sin(angle);
62  beta_min = PI/2; // Initial value of beta
63  dist_min = 1000; // Initial value of distance
64 
65  /* For every element of the object calculate */
66  for(int i=0;i<RES;i++)
67  {
68  for(int j=0;j<RES;j++)
69  {
70  // Compute beta and dist
71  xq = xr-a/2+a*(i/double(RES));
72  yq = yr-b/2+b*(j/double(RES));
73  xv = xp-xq;
74  yv = yp-yq;
75  dist = sqrt(xv*xv+yv*yv);
76  if(dist==0) beta=0;
77  else beta =
78  acos((xv*c_ang+yv*s_ang)/dist);
79  // Find minimum values
80  if(beta<beta_min)
81  beta_min = beta;
82  if(dist<dist_min)
83  dist_min = dist;
84  }
85  }
86  /* Update matrices with minimum pertinences */
87  M[x+y*RES+dir*RES*RES].data
88  = fmax(0,1.0-(2.0*beta_min/PI));
89  /* Update the minimum distance of P to object */
90  M[x+y*RES+4*RES*RES].data
91  = fmin(1,fmax(0,dist_min*exp(-dist_min/60)/20));
92  }
93  }
94  }
95  }
96 
97  /* Assign matrices to response structure */
98  for (int i=0;i<NZ*RES*RES;i++) res.matrices.push_back(M[i]);
99 
100  /* Optional: Print matrices */
101  for (int dir=0;dir<NZ;dir++)
102  {
103  ROS_INFO("Printing Matrix %d:",dir+1);
104  for (int i=0;i<RES;i++)
105  {
106  for (int j=0;j<RES;j++)
107  printf("%3.2f ", M[i+j*RES+dir*RES*RES].data);
108  printf("\n");
109  }
110  printf("\n\n");
111  }
112 
113  ROS_INFO("Successfully generated landscapes");
114 
115  return true;
116 }
117 
118 /* Main function */
119 int main(int argc, char **argv)
120 {
121  /* Initialize, assign a node handler and advertise service */
122  ros::init(argc, argv, "spatial_reasoning_server");
123  ros::NodeHandle n;
124  ros::ServiceServer service =
125  n.advertiseService("spatial_reasoner", SpatialReasoner);
126  ROS_INFO("Spatial Reasoning service active");
127  ros::spin();
128 
129  return 0;
130 }
